DOCNAME: CASE OF PAPASTAVROU AND OTHERS v. GREECE
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants are involved in a long - standing dispute with the ORG concerning the ownership of land in LOC in Galatsi forming part of a wider area called the “ FAC ” over which the ORG claims ownership . In DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE the ORG expropriated large parts of ORG for various purposes in the public interest .

CARDINAL . In an opinion ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) which was approved by the Minister of Finance in DATE and confirmed by the same minister in DATE , ORG said that ORG belonged to the ORG , since PERSON heirs had failed to prove that they had acquired property rights under title deeds or from adverse possession of the estate . On the basis of that opinion , ORG registered the land possessed by PERSON heirs and subsequently all the plots which had been transferred to third parties by the heirs as public estates . Various sets of proceedings brought against the ORG by PERSON heirs and third parties are still pending in the domestic courts .

CARDINAL . In DATE the Minister of Agriculture decided to extend reafforestation in GPE to a region which included the disputed land . According to that decision , the area had “ consisted , before the destruction and deterioration of the forest vegetation ... , of pine - tree forest which [ had ] progressively deteriorated and was starting to disappear ... ” ( decision no . DATE ) .

ORG expressed the opinion that the area had never been forest land and could not be reafforested , since the decision of ORG of DATE excluded from the scope of reafforestation barren land or parcels owned by individuals . ORG concluded that the city development plan could be extended to the area concerned . CARDINAL previous documents of ORG , dated DATE and DATE , and an expert report concerning ORG had arrived at the same conclusion .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prefect of GPE decided that an area within ORG , including the disputed plot of land , should be reafforested . It was expressly stated in the prefect ’s decision that the aim was “ ... to recreate the forest greenery that [ had ] been destroyed or [ had ] deteriorated by illegal quarrying and other illegal actions , such as land clearing and building , over an area covering QUANTITY . m ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants challenged the prefect ’s decision of DATE in ORG . They claimed that they were the owners of properties that had been created by the parcelling of ORG and were located inside the area set aside for reafforestation . In particular , they contended that the prefect ’s decision sought to deprive them of any rights of possession or ownership in the contested plot . In their additional observations of DATE , they claimed that the underlying reason for the decision was an attempt by the ORG to create a dispute over the applicants’ rights of possession or ownership , despite the fact that there was no basis in law for the decision , since the area had never been a forest in the past .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants invited the ORG to purchase the plot in question from them . The authorities did not reply .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the applicants’ appeal inadmissible on the ground that the prefect ’s decision was not an operative one , since it simply confirmed the decision that had been issued by ORG in DATE . In particular , ORG held that the DATE decision remained in force because it had not been reversed by any other act of equivalent importance . Subsequent acts of the authorities , such as the interpretation of some aerial photographs , could not be considered as a fresh assessment of the situation capable of rendering the prefect ’s decision operative .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , following the procedure prescribed by LAW no . CARDINAL , classified QUANTITY . m of land located within the area concerned by the prefect ’s decision of DATE . It concluded that QUANTITY . m of it was forest land and should be reafforested . ORG upheld that decision and an appeal is now pending before ORG .

CARDINAL . In various judgments over DATE the NORP courts have been called upon to decide the property status of parts of ORG ( judgments no . CARDINAL of ORG , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of ORG , and no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of ORG ) . The courts have recognised that a number of plots which were situated in the greater ORG did not constitute forest land but were private properties which were included in the city development plan . Other judicial decisions ( judgments no . CARDINAL of ORG , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of ORG , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of ORG , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of ORG , and no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of ORG ) concluded that the greater area , which comprised the properties claimed by the applicants , had never been forest land in the past .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the LAW read as follows :

“ The ORG is under a duty to protect the natural and cultural environment . It shall adopt special preventive or repressive measures for the conservation of the environment . Matters pertaining to the protection of forests and forest areas in general shall be regulated by law . Any change in the use of public forests and public forest areas shall be prohibited , except where agricultural development or any other use is beneficial to the national economy or dictated by the national interest . ”

“ Public or private forests or forest areas which have been or are destroyed by fire or otherwise deforested , shall not be divested for that reason of their previous status but shall be designated as reafforestation areas and not used for any other purpose . ”

CARDINAL . The Government submitted that , for the purposes of LAW , which under ORG established case - law is directly applicable , the statutory protection of forests continues without any limitation in time and notwithstanding illegal destruction or deforestation . Moreover , the designation of an area as a reafforestation area and the prohibition of any use detrimental to reafforestation are not left to the discretion of the authorities but are mandatory .
CARDINAL . The relevant sections of PERSON no . CARDINAL read as follows :
“ A ORG shall be established at the seat of each prefecture with jurisdiction to settle disputes over the classification of all or part of an area as forest land and over the limits of such land . ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) If no forest register has been compiled , the classification of all or part of an area as forest land and the determination of the limits thereof ... shall be carried out , at the request of any person having a lawful interest or ex officio , by the competent forestry commission .
( CARDINAL ) ... The classification shall be notified to the person , legal entity or public service having submitted the request ...

( CARDINAL ) The prefect or any other person with a lawful interest may lodge an objection to the aforementioned classification within DATE from the date of notification ... with the ORG mentioned in section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ... The ORG and ORG ... shall decide the objection by a reasoned decision within DATE from the date it is filed ... ”

“ Forests and forest lands which are destroyed or deforested by fire or illegal logging shall be designated reafforestation areas , regardless of any special category they may come into or their location ... ”
“ ( CARDINAL ) The decision to designate land as a reafforestation area shall be taken by the competent prefect . It shall clearly indicate the limits of the area and be accompanied by a plan ...
( CARDINAL ) ... the decision of the prefect mentioned in subsection ( CARDINAL ) shall be taken following a recommendation by the competent forestry inspector . ”

CARDINAL . The Government stressed that the aforementioned provisions establish a special judicial procedure for classifying an area as forest land and aim at settling disputes in a way that binds both the authorities and the individual .
